fields.description:
A user is created in JIRA and saved to an external LDAP repository. In Confluence this LDAP repository is synchronized. The created user is tried to be deleted from within Confluence. This fails, showing an error of missing write permission. Actually, the configured LDAP user has admin permissions, thus writing the directory is possible, as it can be seen within JIRA (same configuration). In LDAP logfiles, no message is logged, so no request to LDAP directory is made.

_Error Message_
User 'test' could not be deleted. For More information see the server log.

_Cause_
removeUser Removing user test from group jira-users

_Stack Trace_
removeMembership Failed to remove 'test' as a member of 'jira-users' -- referer: https://mydomain.com/confluence/admin/users/removeuser.action?username=test | url: /confluence/admin/users/removeuser-confirm.action | userName: admin | action: removeuser-confirm

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38281].
  {panel}

We're still at v5.1.2, but in case this hasn't been changed in later versions:

Currently the PDF export filename uses the date/time format "DDMMYY-hhmm". Recommend changing this to an ISO 8601 format instead such as "YYYYMMDD-hhmm" for several reasons:
* it's the standard
* removes ambiguity, e.g. 140515-1415-023
* allows sequential ordering of filenames on file systems etc.

Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#General_principles
fields.summary: PDF export filename uses non-ISO 8601 format

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After creating an application link between JIRA and Confluence, have JIRA subscribe to Confluence gadget and add the *Confluence Page Gadget* to a JIRA dashboard. You will see the following error in it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4.7 with context path (http://localhost:6471/jira)
# Install Confluence 5.8.4 with context path (http://localhost:5841/conf)
# Create an AppLink between them
# Subscribe to Confluence gadget in JIRA
# Add the *Confluence Page Gadget* to a JIRA dashboard
# Select a space and a page

h3. Expected Results
The page shows up fine with no error

h3. Actual Results
You will see the below error while nothing is thrown in the logs:

*The resource /conf/rest/webResources/1.0/resources, cannot be found*
!error.png|thumbnail!

Clicking on the link will redirect to http://localhost:6471/conf/rest/webResources/1.0/resources which is the wrong port/context path combination
 
h3. Notes
* Tested with both Trusted Application and OAuth
* Also tested with JIRA 6.3.15 and Confluence 5.8.4
* Does *not* happen with JIRA 6.4.7 and Confluence 5.7

h3. Workaround
If JIRA and Confluence URLs do not have a context path, the error doesn't appear.
fields.summary: Confluence Page gadget throws "The resource rest/webResources/1.0/resources, cannot be found." error

h3. Summary
Fields made required through the use of workflow validators cannot be filled in using the Jira Issues Macro form, therefore the JIRA issue cannot be created. Similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23424 but different in that this corresponds to the making fields required through the user of validators.

h3. Steps to Replicate 
# On the JIRA side, go to a project workflow and edit it
# Select the 'Create' transition
# Select the Validators option
# Click 'Add validator'
# Select the 'Fields Required' option
# Select a system field (e.g. labels)
# publish workflow
# try to add issue through JIRA Issues Macro in Confluence
# Label field cannot be filled out because it is not listed

h3. Workaround
Create the issue directly in JIRA
fields.summary: The form provided when creating new issue with JIRA Issues macro should provide a form that contains fields made required through workflow validators

It seems that "Export to Word" is not an option when viewing older revisions of a page in Confluence. The "Export to PDF" function is available in the "Tools" menu though.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and edit it so there are two version
# Go to the Tools (...) menu on the page and see that 'Export to Word' is available
# Go to Tools > Page History
# Open the older version of the page
# Go to the Tools (...) menu on the page and see that 'Export to Word' is NOT available

h3. Workaround
# Go to Tools > Page History
# Click 'Restore this version'
# Export the page to word
# Go back to Page History and restore the latest version again

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After configuring AppLinks to integrate JIRA and Confluence, users can add gadget subscription in JIRA so that Confluence Page Gadgets can be used in the JIRA dashboard. However, when OAuth is used, the *Login & approve* button will always appear. 

Once you click *Login & Approve* and click *Allow*, the gadget will display the contents of the page but the *Login & approve* button will still be visible. When you refresh the page, the gadget will *not* show contents of the page any longer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4.7 and Confluence 5.8.4
# Configure AppLink between JIRA and Confluence (OAuth)
# Create a new JIRA dashboard and a gadget
# In the pop up, click on *Manage gadgets* on the top right and click on *Subscriptions* tab
# Enter the Confluence Base URL as a new subscription
# Go back to the dashboard and add the *Confluence Page Gadget* to the dashboard
# Click *Login & approve* and *Allow* so you can configure the gadget (select space and project)

h3. Expected Results
# Once this is done, the gadget will display the contents of the selected page, with no *Login & approve* button any longer
# Upon a refresh of the page the gadget should still display the contents of the page

h3. Actual Results
# The gadget will display the contents of the page but the *Login & approve* button is still visible
!login.png|thumbnail!
# Upon a refresh of the page, the gadget no longer displays the content of the page. Just a "loading" bar
!load.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
# It doesn't happen when connecting JIRA 6.4.7 to Confluence 5.7.5
# Also happens when using JIRA 6.3.6

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Confluence Page gadget always shows "Login & approve" in JIRA dashboard

h3. Summary
XML-RPC call is triggered by accessing Confluence Manage Add-ons page from loopback, in some cases triggering the notification popup message for the SOAP and XML-RPC deprecation in the UI, causing confusion

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 5.9.0-OD-58-008

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access Manage Add-ons
- https://<Base URL>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm#manage

h3. Expected Results
No XML-RPC Call triggered

h3. Actual Results
the System Plugin:
- Confluence Blogging RPC Plugin

Triggers a XML-RPC Call
The below exception is thrown in the apache access.log file:
{code}
127.0.0.1 - - [25/Jun/2015:09:42:45 -0600] "POST /wiki/rpc/xmlrpc HTTP/1.1" 200 8228 19869 "-" "Jakarta Commons-HttpClient/3.1"
165.254.226.226 216.51.95.40 - [06/Jul/2015:14:29:58 -0600] "GET /wiki/rest/plugins/1.0/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.xmlrpc.bloggingrpc-key/media/plugin-icon HTTP/1.0" 200 696 2236568 "https://<BASE URL>.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/upm/manage/all" "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:37.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/37.0"
{code}
 
h3. Notes
if page is accesses or refreshed enough times in a 30 day window it will trigger the Pop-up notification for SOAP and XML-RPC deprecation as noted here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/SOAP+and+XML-RPC+removal+in+JIRA+Cloud

h3.Workaround
Atlassian Support can Disable the notification upon request, file a support case at: https://support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: XML-RPC call triggered by Confluence Manage add-ons

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the 'Section' macro, all paragraphs except the first will be hidden after saving the page. This happens to text inserted before the first table or any 'Formatting' macros inserted into the page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.8.5 up to 5.10.6
* Mozilla Firefox 49.0 (Current latest version)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence.
# Add the 'Section' macro to this page.
#* Insert > Other Macros > Section
# Add a few paragraphs of text inside the 'Section' macro.
# Add a table or any macros under the 'Formatting' category after the paragraphs.
# Save the page.

h3. Expected Results
All content are displayed properly.

h3. Actual Results
Only the first paragraph from the 'Section' macro is displayed. Other paragraphs are hidden.

Upon clicking edit, all contents are displayed as it should.

!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
# Only observed with all paragraphs before the table except the first paragraph.
# Not observed in other browsers such as Chrome or Internet Explorer.
# Observed in previous version of Confluence since 5.7.5.
# But not observed in Confluence 5.1.3 (As per customer's information).
fields.summary: Section panel will hide few text paragraphs if it contains a table or any 'Formatting' macros

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The new Inline Comment feature has a "Resolve" button. It does not generate notifications when clicked

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.7 and above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and add attachment in it. 
# Add Inline Comments anywhere in the attachment. @mention a person in the comment. The mentioned user gets a notification
# As the mentioned user (or anyone else), click the "Resolve" button on the inline comments

h3. Expected Results
As per this blog, (http://blogs.atlassian.com/2015/02/introducing-new-feedback-loop-confluence-5-7), original commenter should receive a notification
{quote}
4. Close your feedback loop and get it done
The final step in a feedback loop is closing it and letting all your contributors know you’ve incorporated their feedback. You can now resolve inline comments on any page or file to indicate you’ve read and reacted to the feedback. The original commenter receives a notification when comments are resolved. Once all the feedback has been resolved, you’ve completed the drafting process and should have your final draft in hand.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
Original Commenter does not receive any notification
 
h3. Notes
We do not find this feature mentioned in the released notes:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Simplifyyourteam'sfeedbackloop
fields.summary: Inconsistencies about inline comments feedback loop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38248].
  {panel}

The dashboard "Popular" tab is intended to show the content that has gained attention - likes, comments, etc. Content which has a lot of interaction is pushed to the top, and the top 3 goes out in "recommended content" emails.

With the new "Inline Comments" feature, this model is not quite working in the same way. A page which is a "work-in-progress" is likely to get a lot of inline comments as different people review and contribute. Each piece of feedback is counted as a single "comment". This does not mean that the page is popular, and it may not yet be ready for sharing more widely.

As pages are open by default, this means that unfinished drafts can start appearing as the most popular content items, above the actual published blog posts which have fewer comments overall.

I suggest that inline comments should be weighted differently from regular comments to avoid this.
fields.summary: Reduce or remove weighting of inline comments in the "Popular" tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38246].
  {panel}

Since Confluence 5.5 it is deprecated to store files in a database, leaving filesystem storage the only option left.
How about adding support for S3 and/or Swift object storage to store attachments and files ?

Using object storage as a file backend would simplify the following tasks:
* backup (storage is already replicated)
* multiple versions
* scalability (both storage space and load)
fields.summary: Add support for object storage backend

h3. Actual Results

I assume the same page is used for either JDBC or datasource and the unnecessary parts are hidden, and if that is the case the warning box to append these MySQL JDBC specific connection string arguments is not hidden

Ignore the warning box until it is removed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38238].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Computable Document Format (.cdf) is a proprietary interactive document format from [Wolfram Alpha|https://www.wolfram.com/cdf/].
There is currently no way to embed this in Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a macro to support embedding this format.
 
h3. Workaround 
- Wolfram Alpha discusses [how to create a script to embed the file|http://blog.wolfram.com/2012/02/22/mathematica-qa-series-cdf-embedding-in-a-nutshell/]
- Use the [HTML macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/HTML+Macro] to display a page that has embedded the file, using [iFrame in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+put+an+IFrame+into+Confluence]
- No Workaround for Confluence Cloud
fields.summary: Support Computable Document Format (.cdf) as embedded macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38237].
  {panel}

This is reproducible on confluence.atlassian.com - the attached Word document has been generated from there.

Doing a {{head}} on the file results in the following:

{quote}
Message-ID: <1657636268.3573.1436525934483.JavaMail.svc_confluence_prod@node471.prod.inf.atlassian.com>
Subject: Exported From Confluence
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/related; 
	boundary="----=_Part_3572_816584643.1436525934481"

------=_Part_3572_816584643.1436525934481
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Location: file:///C:/exported.html
{quote}

Basically what is going on is that this is a multi-part email which Microsoft Word is able to display. It is not a real binary .doc file which can be opened by other tools which can open Word documents.

h4. Additional Information
If a Confluence page that contains image being exported to Word and when this Word file is attached again into the Confluence page, the image will not be able to rendered properly. Most probably due to the file not being an actual _.doc_ file:
 !Attachment in Page.png|thumbnail! 
 !File Preview.png|thumbnail! 


h4. Workaround
Open the exported file with Microsoft Word and use the *Save As..* option to save the file as _.doc_ or _.docx_ file
fields.summary: "Export to Word" results in '.doc' files which cannot be opened by iOS, Preview or Pages

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Resolution as of 11 August 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
This issue consists of 2 underlying symptoms relating to the PDF Conversion Service where the Confluence system can become unresponsive or crash:
 * Sustained high CPU usage
 * Occasional OutOfMemoryError


h3. Confluence Improvements:

The PDF Conversion Service is built on top of a 3rd party library (Aspose), requiring an ongoing Enterprise support case between Atlassian and the Aspose team. Outside of this dependency, we have independently investigated and implemented a number of changes in the way we utilise the Aspose library in order to address this issue. Thus far, we believe that we have resolved the sustained high CPU usage with the following improvements:
 # The conversion service is executed by a group of threads, managed by a thread pool. The thread pool is now dynamically managed to be inline with available system resources including the current CPU usage, memory usage as well as the current system load. In other words, the system will not launch more conversions if the system is busy and additional resources are not available.
 # The latest Aspose library has been implemented, including many improvements and bug fixes.


h3. Remaining Issue:
The Aspose library continues to require a high amount of memory for the PDF conversion service, which means the system might still experience an OutOfMemoryError. This is more prevalent when converting the extra-large PDF files (e.g. file size is above 100MB), which could exceed the available heap memory. Once the OutOfMemoryError occurs, the system is likely to be slow to respond to user requests, and a Confluence restart is recommended.
 Workaround for OutOfMemoryError:
 # Reduce the system level maximum attachment size to <100MB
 # Increase the heap memory for the Confluence instance if possible

h3. Further Development

The Confluence development team is looking into additional strategies to tackle the potential memory issue.
 Please refer to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-43363 for any ongoing issues relating to the OutOfMemoryError issue
 If you have any ongoing issues with respect to CPU spikes following upgrading to version 5.10.4+, please feel free to comment here or raise a support request.

Best regards,
 Minh Tran
 Confluence BugMaster
 Atlassian
{panel}
h3. Summary

Symptoms:
 * When adding large PDF or Office files to a Confluence page the attachment does not render as thumbnail on the page
 * There is also possibility that the CPU usage will be spiking to 100% during the time and if it does
 * The threads are not released until Confluence instance is restarted

Following appears in the thread dumps:
{noformat}
"conversion-thread-0-internal" #1530 daemon prio=1 os_prio=0 tid=0x0000000001184000 nid=0x8eb runnable [0x00007f67075f3000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p560.z13.m7(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p560.z13.m2(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p560.z13.m6(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p560.z13.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p559.z1.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p543.z4.m2(Unknown Source)
	- locked <0x00000000fcf6cc78> (a java.lang.Object)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p502.z4.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p502.z3.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p502.z4.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p525.z1.m2(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p525.z1.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p525.z1.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p525.z1.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p525.z1.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p512.z20.m2(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p512.z20.m4(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p512.z7.m2(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.internal.p512.z7.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.devices.z1.m1(Unknown Source)
	- locked <0x00000000d45001e0> (a com.aspose.pdf.Document)
	at com.aspose.pdf.devices.z1.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.devices.ImageDevice.m1(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.devices.JpegDevice.processInternal(Unknown Source)
	at com.aspose.pdf.devices.JpegDevice.process(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.conversion.convert.image.ImagingConverter.thumbnailForPdf(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.conversion.convert.image.ImagingConverter.generateThumbnailDirect(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.doWork(JVMConversionRunnable.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable.run(ConversionRunnable.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.run(JVMConversionRunnable.java:18)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)




{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Select *Files and Images* from the *Insert* dropdown. Can be reproduced using [^samplepdf.pdf]
 # Upload a PDF with number in its filename
h3. Expected Results


The PDF thumbnail should render as it does for smaller PDF files
h3. Actual Results

The PDF does not render properly, also see the symptoms above.

Refer the below Screenshot :
 !pdf_thumbnail.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

[Add the JVM Parameter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] {{-Dconfluence.document.conversion.threads=3}} and restart Confluence for the changes to take effect. While this is not a fix for the problem, it should reduce the number of threads spawned for document conversion; and subsequently reduce overall CPU usage. This parameter is only valid for the affected versions listed (i.e, Confluence 5.7 and above).

Alternatively, it is possible to disable the file conversion service altogether: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/File+conversion+service+causes+out+of+memory+errors+in+Confluence+5.7+or+above]
h4. Vendor ticket

Aspose is the third-party library Confluence uses for processing PDF files. The reference ticket for this bug:
 [http://www.aspose.com/community/forums/thread/672293/locking-all-threads-on-the-server.aspx]

fields.description:
When a new Confluence database is created on 5.6, 5.7 (older versions do apply as well), the AO tables are created using the VARCHAR datatype even if using the correct dialect for SQL server.

It is known that Confluence must use the NVARCHAR, NTEXT and NCHAR datatypes as stated in this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+upgrade+fails+because+SQL+Server+could+not+complete+schema+update], however AO (Active Objects) tables always used VARCHAR as a pattern.

Recently in Confluence 5.8 version, all AO tables are meant to use NVARCHAR, *however* if you came from 5.7 or any older version of Confluence, the AO tables that were using VARCHAR datatypes *are not* altered to the correct NVARCHAR datatype upon upgrading to 5.8.x.

This is causing many issues with functionalities/plugins that depends on AO tables such as Team Calendars for example. If a new version of Team calendar tries to create a new AO table on 5.8.4, it will try to use the NVARCHAR datatype and if it tries to create a constraint (EG. FK) between a column using VACHAR and another using NVARCHAR, the table creation fails, hence the plugin/functionality stops working correctly.

This screenshoot shows the discrepancy between different AO tables created before and after the upgrade to 5.8.x 

!different_datatypes.JPG|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to replicate the bug
1) Install a Confluence vanilla in 5.7 or any older version on SQL server using the correct dialect in confluence.cfg.xml file (net.sf.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerIntlDialect)
2) Install an older version of team calendar such as 5.2.10 and setup a license for team calendar
3) Upgrade Confluence to 5.8.4
4) Upgrade Team calendar to the latest version (5.2.16)

This will break the team calendar plugin with the following message:
{code}
ERROR [active-objects-init-system tenant-0] [net.java.ao.sql] handleUpdateError Exception executing SQL update <CREATE TABLE AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS (
    ALL_DAY BIT CONSTRAINT df_AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS_ALL_DAY DEFAULT 0 NOT NULL,
    ASSIGNEE NVARCHAR(255),
    DESCRIPTION NTEXT,
    EVENT_TYPE NVARCHAR(255),
    ID INTEGER IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,
    ISSUE_ICON_URL NVARCHAR(255),
    ISSUE_LINK NVARCHAR(255),
    JQL NVARCHAR(255),
    KEY_ID NVARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    STATUS NVARCHAR(255),
    SUB_CALENDAR_ID NVARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    TICKET_ID NVARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    TITLE NVARCHAR(255),
    USER_ID NVARCHAR(255),
    UTC_END BIGINT CONSTRAINT df_AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS_UTC_END DEFAULT 0,
    UTC_START BIGINT CONSTRAINT df_AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS_UTC_START DEFAULT 0,
    CONSTRAINT fk_ao_950dc3_tc_jira_remi_events_sub_calendar_id FOREIGN KEY (SUB_CALENDAR_ID) REFERENCES AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS(ID),
CONSTRAINT pk_AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS_ID PRIMARY KEY(ID)
)>
 -- url: /rest/plugins/1.0/ | referer: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX | userName: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
java.sql.SQLException: Column 'AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS.ID' is not the same data type as referencing column 'AO_950DC3_TC_JIRA_REMI_EVENTS.SUB_CALENDAR_ID' in foreign key 'fk_ao_950dc3_tc_jira_remi_events_sub_calendar_id'.
{code}

h3. *Workaround*

If you are in 5.7 or any older version of Confluence, the Team Calendars AO tables are created with VARCHAR datatypes, instead of NVARCHAR. To avoid the errors that has been described above _Steps to replicate the bug_ section, you must then first change the wrongly set datatype to the correct column datatype. Unfortunately, this must be done manually.

You may do so by creating an alteration script and running the script to change the table or follow the exact steps to change the datatypes from this [KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+upgrade+fails+because+SQL+Server+could+not+complete+schema+update] - "Modify each data type manually" section.

h3. *Working Workaround*
Fix is provided in 5.9.1 but customers who want to upgrade to 5.8 can use steps published onto 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+upgrade+active+objects+columns+from+varchar+to+nvarchar+in+SQL+Server to get all columns upgraded from varchar to nvarchar.


h3. *QR Notes*
* Create confluence compatible test database:
{noformat}
CREATE DATABASE CONF_38232_14;
ALTER DATABASE CONF_38232_14 COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CS_AS;
ALTER DATABASE CONF_38232_14 SET READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON WITH ROLLBACK IMMEDIATE;
use CONF_38232_14;
{noformat}
* Install confluence 5.7 on it.
* Install Team Calendars 5.2.10
* Make sure that there are columns with varchar type:
{noformat}
SELECT syo.name as table_name, syc.name as column_name 
FROM sysobjects syo 
JOIN syscolumns syc
ON syc.id = syo.id
JOIN systypes syt
ON syt.xtype = syc.xtype
WHERE syt.name = 'varchar'
and syo.name like 'AO_%'
ORDER by syo.name, syc.name;
{noformat}
* Shutdown confluence 
* Install confluence from `issue-58/CONF-38232` branch name re-using old confluence home
* Make sure that upgrade task has run and all ddl queries are logged
* Make sure that no SQL errors on confluence or AO upgrades
* Install Team Calendars 5.2.16
* Make sure that no constraints error in log files
* Make sure that plugin is enabled and all modules (except `event` one) are enabled
* Run query above to check that there are no columns with 'varchar' type left.
fields.summary: AO tables are created using the incorrect VARCHAR datatype in SQL server

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38231].

h4. Problem
The currently widely used IPv4 address pool is close to exhaustion: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv4_address_exhaustion]. IPv6 is around already for a while, however parts of our products may (and do) break.

h4. Requirement
- Add IPv6 tests for products and clarify it being supported for all parts of the products (external system connectivity, applinks, self-naming, reverse-proxying, etc).
- Update the supported platforms documentation and explicitly specify IPv6 to be supported to avoid confusion and give support a reference point.

fields.description:
Today, I discovered that in Confluence 5.5.6 and 5.8.5 we are able to do the following:
# User 1 moves a page tree A from space X to space Y
# User 2 does not know that user 1 is already moving the page tree A. He is able to click on move and then moves the page tree A from space X to space Z
# On the background, 2 requests are running trying to move page tree A to two different locations
# After a while, user 1 will get an error 'Move failed. There was a problem contacting the server.'
# After some time, user 2 will also get an error 'Move failed. There was a problem contacting the server.'
# One can observer that page tree A was moved to space Z, but not completely. It seems that some pages are missing / lost.
# User 1 and user 2 will get no notification that page tree A was moved (not completely) to space Z.

What should be done to solve this and improve page move handling?:
--> Users should not be allowed to move a page tree while another user is doing a move operation on the page tree.
---> Users should be informed properly about the ongoing process.
----> As a user I also want to see the progess (% or amount vs. total amount of pages that are moved)

From an administrator point of view, this is also annoying since it can cause deadlocks on database, higher CPU usage, ...
fields.summary: User is able to move a page tree although another user is moving it at the same time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38209].
  {panel}

I often have meetings relating to this or that JIRA Task, Story, Epic, etc.,  I keep track of the meeting and follow-ups in Confluence, creating Confluence tasks as I go.  Often these tasks relate directly to a JIRA ticket.  It would be very convenient to have an easy way to view all Confluence tasks that relate to this or that JIRA ticket within said ticket (rather than creating a link manually in the Confluence document, and then clicking on the resulting link in JIRA to see if there were any tasks that relate to the JIRA ticket).

Maybe this could involve a specialized Confluence Macro, identifying a JIRA ticket that will display all the tasks in the Confluence page (with the ability to check said tasks in the JIRA ticket), as well as link type in JIRA that would identify individual Confluence records whose tasks will be brought into the JIRA ticket.

Finally, it would be good to have a separate area for Confluence tasks within the JIRA ticket - maybe something like the areas for the lists of linked tickets and sub-tasks that are currently found in JIRA tickets.

I created a ticket in the JIRA project for this functionality -  [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44195] for this functionality.

Thanks,

Daniel.
fields.summary: Allow for the inclusion of Confluence Tasks in JIRA Tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38208].
  {panel}

I use the Create from Template Macro extensively - especially for the creation of meeting minutes that relate to specific projects or project groups.  

The only difference between the minutes document would be the labels I would want to associate with the minutes (different projects would have different labels, which will then allow me to easily track and aggregate the meeting records).  The creation of a separate template for each label feels wasteful and convoluted, as well as being an administrative overhead, as regular users cannot create templates that can be accessed by other users.

On the  other hand, users can add the Create from Template Macro button to any Confluence page they author or edit, and having labels generated automatically once a record is created - based on a configuration in the Macro itself will provide:

1. Flexibility (creating a variation in the same template by allowing it to be created with different labels).
2. Prevention of mistakes and missed information - Currently I need to put in the label (sometimes multiple labels) after the document is saved.  I may forget to do it, and so the document may fail to appear where it is supposed to because of the missing label.

Thanks,

Daniel.

I have cloned this Ticket from [CONF-28476|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28476] because I think it was closed without ever being solved. I think the importance of this is significant to the usefulness of the product:
* For example: Be able to reproducibly assign people to many tasks in a confluence task or checklist just by filling in a few fields

Also, dates should also be able to be used in template variables.

It is currently not possible to @mention someone in a template variable. Allowing this could improve uptake of Confluence for new customers, by increasing visibility of Confluence in the business.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When browsing Confluence via IE 11 , the browser memory increases and after sometime IE does not response.

h3. Environment
Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Confluence using IE 11
# Open any page (You can also test this on confluence.atlassian.com)
# Press the development tools with F12, open Memory and start profiling (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn255003(v=vs.85).aspx)
# Just switch between pages and browse the confluence instance
# You should see an increase of memory usage with every switch

h3. Expected Results
IE 11 should not crash and run normally

h3. Actual Results
IE 11 stops working 
 
h3. Notes
You will not be able to replicate this issue if you have large amount of RAM on your machine . I was able to replicate this when the browser memory reached 2 GB .
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 11 memory increases continuosly when browsing Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When browsing Confluence via IE 11 , the browser memory increases and after sometime IE does not response.
h3. Environment

Internet Explorer 11
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence using IE 11
 # Open any page (You can also test this on confluence.atlassian.com)
 # Press the development tools with F12, open Memory and start profiling ([https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn255003(v=vs.85).aspx])
 # Just switch between pages and browse the confluence instance
 # You should see an increase of memory usage with every switch

h3. Expected Results

IE 11 should not crash and run normally
h3. Actual Results

IE 11 stops working
h3. Notes

You will not be able to replicate this issue if you have large amount of RAM on your machine . I was able to replicate this when the browser memory reached 2 GB .
{panel:title=Atlassian Resolution|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Thanks for your interest in this issue.

As we dug deeper into the IE11 memory leak issue, we have been able to reliably reproduce the leak within IE11 11.0.9600.18861 (circa 08/2017) on Windows 8. Using a vanilla Confluence installation and refreshing the page a number of time, it can be observed that the memory consumed by the page itself remains consistent, however the iexplore.exe process continues to grow.

Restesting on IE11 11.251.16299.0 (circa 02/2018) and Edge 41.16299.248.0 on Windows 10 we were unable to reproduce the same memory leak.

We have not been able to find a definitive list of the issues fixed in this IE11 release, but believe the issue is [Memory leak - IE Edge - Microsoft Edge 8020622|https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/8020622/] (previosuly fixed in Edge only). Therefore, whilst we are confident that this issue can be resolved, there is a small chance that there still remains an issue.

*Resolution:* Please upgrade to Windows 8/10 and the latest version of IE11 (11.251.16299.0) circa 02/2018 and Edge 41.16299.248.0 or greater to fix this issue. NOTE: The issue persists on Windows 7 for which we have not plans to address this as we believe the issues lies with Microsoft.

Cheers,

The Confluence Server team
{panel}
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 11 memory increases continuously when browsing Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38169].
  {panel}

h3. Background

Confluence allow administrators to control some of the content of workbox notifications for example, integrated application notification such as JIRA. However this option is not provided for the users.

For example, some users such as developer team might relies heavily on JIRA notification, but other department might not. Hence JIRA notification could hinder these users to see the important notification.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide workbox notification configuration menu in "User Profile" similar to "Email" notification configuration which is available now.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38146].
  {panel}

At the moment, there is no way to add nor to remove team members from a team space blueprint

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new team space blueprint
# Click on *Space Tools* > *Permission*
# Click on Edit permission
# Add or remove user from the list.
# Go to team space page. The user is not added to the team space nor removed.

*Expected Behaviour*
User is added in the team space automagically.

*Workaround*
Need to do it manually. Add another row or column to the table with the Profile picture macro and then add mailto-link macro below the profile picture.
fields.summary: Allow user to add or remove team members from a team space
